page.title: 10FARMING IN THE AREA
page.content: The Barford - Burcombe area is gently hilly chalkland. The open countryside is predominately arable. Mainly cereal growing is practised on a non-rotational basis, being totally dependent on fertilizers and chemical sprays. Towards the river the land supports livestock, mainly sheep, as the ground will not support arable here, although this has been attempted in the past. Farming in the area is mainly controlled by large estates, which are highly mechanised and employ few workers - tractor drivers and shepherds are among those employed.
